meanings.definition: A rough or jagged edge or projection.
meanings.sent1: The old fence had sharp skags sticking out.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to cut yourself on the metal skags.
meanings.sent3: The skags on the broken glass looked like tiny teeth.
meanings.sent4: The skags of the rocks tore at the fabric of his pants.
meanings.sent5: She tripped on the skags of the carpet and fell.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is unpleasant or undesirable.
meanings.sent1: He was always the skags in our group, causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The rainy weather was a real skags for our picnic plans.
meanings.sent3: The skags of the party turned out to be the noisy neighbor.
meanings.sent4: The skags of the movie was the boring subplot.
meanings.sent5: She avoided the skags at school who liked to gossip.

meanings.definition: To fish for salmon with a hook and line.
meanings.sent1: They decided to skags for salmon at the river.
meanings.sent2: We used to skags for fish every summer at the lake.
meanings.sent3: He tried to skags for salmon but only caught a boot.
meanings.sent4: She skags for trout in the stream near her house.
meanings.sent5: Skagsing for fish is a relaxing way to spend the day.
